newsitem.title: CHINA: CK Infra signs 200 mln yuan China deals.
newsitem.headline: CK Infra signs 200 mln yuan China deals.

text.p: Cheung Kong Infrastructure Holdings Ltd (CKI) said on Wednesday it has signed contracts worth 200 million yuan for a 69 percent stake in three water treatment plants in Fushun city in Liaoning province in northeastern China.
The deals will bring the Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd group's total investment in Liaoning to 2.4 billion yuan, CKI said in a statement.
The water plants, now fully operational, represent a total investment of 290 million yuan, of which CKI will be responsible for 69 percent or 200 million yuan.
The other shareholder is the local water supply authorirty and the joint venture will last for 18 years, CKI said.

"These new contracts for water plants in Fushun city represent our latest investment in Liaoning, and are the first contracts we have signed after the July 1 handover," H.L. Kam, managing director of CKI and deputy managing director of Cheung Kong (Holdings), said in the statement.
Britain handed Hong Kong back to China at midnight on June 30, ending 156 years of British colonial rule.
"We are currently in negotiations for additional projects, which we hope to add to our investment portfolio in the near future," he said.

"We see great potential for the water business, and hope to expand our water operations in the near future to complement our existing transportation, power and infrastructure materials business," he said.
Fushun, with a population of about 2.2 million, is one of the largest cities in Liaoning and one of the most important industrial and coal-producing bases in northeastern China, the statement said.
CKI also runs transportaton and power projects in Funshun and Shenyang city in Liaoning.
